member.name: T:Ipfs.Http.IpfsClient
member.summary: A client that allows access to the InterPlanetary File System (IPFS).
member.remarks: The API is based on the IPFS commands.
IpfsClient is thread safe, only one instance is required by the application.

member.name: F:Ipfs.Http.IpfsClient.DefaultApiUri
member.summary: The default URL to the IPFS HTTP API server.
member.remarks: The environment variable "IpfsHttpApi" overrides this value.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Http.IpfsClient.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class and sets the default values.
member.remarks: All methods of IpfsClient are thread safe. Typically, only one instance is required for an application.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Http.IpfsClient.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class and specifies the API host's URL. default values
member.param: The URL of the API host. For example "http://localhost:5001" or "http://ipv4.fiddler:5001".

member.name: P:Ipfs.Http.IpfsClient.ApiUri
member.summary: The URL to the IPFS API server. The default is "http://localhost:5001".

member.name: P:Ipfs.Http.IpfsClient.UserAgent
member.summary: The value of HTTP User-Agent header sent to the API server.
member.value: The default value is "net-ipfs/M.N", where M is the major and N is minor version numbers of the assembly.

member.name: P:Ipfs.Http.IpfsClient.TrustedPeers
member.summary: The list of peers that are initially trusted by IPFS.
member.remarks: This is equilivent to ipfs bootstrap list.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Http.IpfsClient.Api
member.summary: Get the IPFS API.
member.remarks: Only one client is needed. Its thread safe.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Http.IpfsClient.DoCommandAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Perform an IPFS API command returning a string.
member.param: The IPFS API command, such as "file/ls".
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
The optional argument to the command.
The optional flags to the command.
member.returns: A string representation of the command's result.
member.exception: When the IPFS server indicates an error.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Http.IpfsClient.DoCommandAsync``1(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Perform an IPFS API command returning a specific .
member.param: The IPFS API command, such as "file/ls".
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
The optional argument to the command.
The optional flags to the command.
member.remarks: The command's response is converted to using JsonConvert.
member.exception: When the IPFS server indicates an error.

member.summary: Perform an IPFS API command returning a a byte array.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Http.IpfsClient.UploadAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken,System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Perform an IPFS API command that requires uploading of a "file".
member.param: The IPFS API command, such as "add".
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
A containing the data to upload.
The name associated with the , can be null. Typically a filename, such as "hello.txt".
The optional flags to the command.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task's value is the HTTP response as a string.
member.exception: When the IPFS server indicates an error.

member.exception: When the IPFS server indicates an error.

member.summary: A link to another file system node in IPFS.

member.name: P:Ipfs.Http.FileSystemNode.Size
member.summary: Size of the file contents.
member.value: This is the size of the file not the raw encoded contents of the block.

member.name: P:Ipfs.Http.FileSystemNode.IsDirectory
member.summary: Determines if the link is a directory (folder).
member.value: true if the link is a directory; Otherwise false, the link is some type of a file.

member.summary: The file name of the IPFS node.

member.summary: The client to IPFS.
member.value: Used to fetch additional information on the node.

member.name: T:Ipfs.Http.MerkleNode
member.summary: The IPFS MerkleDag is the datastructure at the heart of IPFS. It is an acyclic directed graph whose edges are hashes.
member.remarks: Initially an MerkleNode is just constructed with its Cid.

member.name: T:Ipfs.Http.TrustedPeerCollection
member.summary: A list of trusted peers.
member.remarks: This is the list of peers that are initially trusted by IPFS. Its equivalent to the ipfs bootstrap command.
member.returns: A series of . Each address ends with an IPNS node id, for example "/ip4/104.131.131.82/tcp/4001/ipfs/QmaCpDMGvV2BGHeYERUEnRQAwe3N8SzbUtfsmvsqQLuvuJ".

member.name: M:Ipfs.Http.TrustedPeerCollection.AddDefaultNodes
member.summary: Add the default bootstrap nodes to the trusted peers.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Http.TrustedPeerCollection.Clear
member.summary: Remove all the trusted peers.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Http.TrustedPeerCollection.Remove(Ipfs.MultiAddress)
member.summary: Remove the trusted peer.
member.remarks: Equivalent to ipfs bootstrap rm peer.
